name: Convolution of A000203 with itself.
comment: a(5*n+1)==0 (mod 5) and a(7*n+6)==0 (mod 7). See Bonciocat link. - _Michel Marcus_, Nov 10 2016
Convolution of A340793 and A024916. - _Omar E. Pol_, Feb 17 2021
reference: N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
J. Touchard, On prime numbers and perfect numbers, Scripta Math., 129 (1953), 35-39.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Nicolae Ciprian Bonciocat, Congruences for the Convolution of Divisor sum function, Bull. Greek Math. Soc., p. 19-29, Vol 47, 2003.
MathOverflow, Searching for a proof for a series identity
S. Ramanujan, On certain arithmetical functions, Transactions of the Cambridge Philosophical Society, 22, No.9 (1916), 169- 184 (see Table IV, line 1).
J. Touchard, On prime numbers and perfect numbers, Scripta Math., 129 (1953), 35-39. [Annotated scanned copy]
formula: Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ Pi^4 * n^4 / 864. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Apr 02 2019
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[DivisorSigma[1, k] DivisorSigma[1, n-k+1], {k, 1, n}];
program: a000385 n = sum $ zipWith (*) sigmas $ reverse sigmas where
(PARI) a(n) = sum(k=1, n, sigma(k)*sigma(n-k+1)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 10 2016
return(5*prod((p**(3*(e+1))-1)//(p**3-1) for p,e in f)-(5+6*n)*prod((p**(e+1)-1)//(p-1) for p, e in f))//12 # _Chai Wah Wu_, Jul 25 2024
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: More terms from _Sean A. Irvine_, Nov 14 2010
